description:
WHERE

The meeting will take place in the Azzar room which is upstairs on the opposite side from the Betagroup Coworking Space.

 

PRESENTATIONS

Kim Gjerstad from Wysija Newsletters will talk about how to build a business from an open source plugin.

Wysija is one of the top 100 WordPress plugins. Kim will also be on hand to show you how their newsletter creator works.

Gilbert West will talk about, "So now you have a WordPress web site, who is responsible for security."

 

TRANSPORT

Metro: Petillon (Line 5) direction Herrmann Debroux

Tram: Arsenal or Hansen Soulie

Bike: Bike parking is available outside in the part of the park adjacent to the ICAB building.

Car: Street parking is free after 18.30, but some of the local streets have major roadworks at the moment and are inaccessible.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: Monthly WordPress Meetup

description:
LOCATION INFO: We'll be in the same venue as last time, the Azzar room at ICAB.

At the last meeting we had a request to discuss WooCommerce. So I'll be doing a demo of WooCommerce and how to go about setting up an online shop.

For the bloggers, there will be a short talk on Google's moves to link authorship to google+ profiles (naughty, naughty Google), how that affects SEO and what you need to do to benefit.

There will also be an opportunity to have a design critique of your website done by Tricia Okin, a web & mobile application designer who is visiting from New York.

TRANSPORT

Metro: Petillon (Line 5) direction Herrmann Debroux

Tram: Arsenal or Hansen Soulie

Bike: Bike parking is available outside in the part of the park adjacent to the ICAB building.

Car: Street parking is free after 18.30, but some of the local streets have major roadworks at the moment and are inaccessible.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: Monthly WordPress Meetup

description:
Monday 27th of May is the 10th anniversary of the first release of WordPress.

So we'll be breaking with our 3rd Tuesday of the month tradition and holding our meetup on that day instead.

If you're stuck on a project or want some feedback about your site come along and we'll figure things out together.

Even if you haven't started your website yet and want help figuring out how to start, bring your idea along and we'll help you plan how to get started.
name: Monthly WordPress Meetup - WordPress 10th Anniversary

description:
Hi Wordpressers.

It's looking like there might some thunderstorms at some point on Tuesday so let's play it safe and go back to the Flamingo instead having a picnic in the park.

So this month's meetup theme is blogging.

Motivations, tips on how to keep going, useful tools to help promote your writing.

No slides or presentations this time, just chatting and sharing stories over a beer.

See you all Tuesday night at the Flamingo ( same place as last time )
name: Monthly WordPress Meetup

description:
Let's get some of you live and online if you're struggling getting started.

Demonstrate the new group web site so that you can get regular tips, find help and post jobs etc.

venue.name: NettoWatt
venue.address_1: Rue de la Victoire 26, St Gilles

name: Last Monthly Meetup Before Summer Break

description:
Following a request from a member, September's meetup will include a new feature.

WordPress Breakdown!

Tell us about some WordPress websites that you admire.

We'll break them down and tell you how they were made.

As usual, bring your WordPress questions, problems, things you want to try and we'll help or at least point you in the right direction.
name: Monthly WordPress Meetup

description:
The door of ICAB has been fixed so it's a viable event venue again!

We'll have a couple of talks/demonstrations this session.

1. A report from WordCamp Europe - I have lots of free swag for you including t-shirts, free hosting for 1 year and free online training courses and of course ... stickers.

2. A talk by Gilbert (@blueclock) on using the Advanced Custom Fields Plugin in a podcast project.

3. Kristof Bernaert (@ssstofff) will give demonstration of Dynamik Website Builder for the Genesis framework.

4. Website breakdown - let's pick a great web site and figure out how a website was made, what themes and plugins were used etc.

5. We're going to build a plugin! 2 minute introduction to this new side project starting in November.

6. Call for speakers - you can respond right now!

7. Info about the meetups that we're organising in Gent and Antwerp.

See you all there.

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

how_to_find_us: We will be in the Azzar room of the ICAB. Upstairs on the left of the building. Nearest Metro, Petillon ( line 5 ). Tram stop Hansen Soulie. Street parking free after 6.30pm
name: October WordPress Meetup

description:
Do you want to participate in a project to create a WordPress plugin? You should have some php skills but any level is welcome. The aim of the project is to help people learn, teach or improve their skills in:

• How to make a plugin

• PHP

• WordPress coding conventions 

• Plugin security best practices 

• Git - working with code repositories

• Team work and planning

This will be the preliminary meeting to decide how we work together and what skills people can contribute / want to learn.

We'll also discuss what to build. Ideas from anyone in the Meetup group are welcome.
name: Plug-in Creation Project ( Kickoff Meeting )

description:
This month we have 2 speakers and we'll be taking a look at some SEO basics and making money from content.

Pieter Dubois from Paycento will talk to us about how you can get people to pay for your content using their micro payment system. It's a very smooth concept, where people top up a virtual wallet then pay for items online, such as news articles or videos, using their social profile e.g. twitter or facebook as their proof of identity.

Paycento have implemented plugins for WordPress and Drupal, so you can get set up relatively quickly.

We can also have a wider discussion about what types of content are best to sell and other strategies for generating an income from blogging.

Chris Smit from Internet Business Questions will give us an overview of how to do keyword analysis to make sure that people actually find the content that you want them to read and sometimes pay for.
how_to_find_us: Rue du Fort 35 / Fort Straat 35, 1060 St. Gilles / Sint-Gillis, Brussels
name: November WordPress Meetup

description:
Come and hangout socially with WP BRU members. We're WordPress users, designers, writers developers and a whole bunch of other things.

PianoFabriek is where we'll be hosting all of our meetups in 2014 ( not in the bar! ) so come and check out the building, have a drink and get to know your fellow WordPressers.
how_to_find_us: We'll be in the bar. It's easy to find, on the ground floor
name: WordPress End of Year Drink

description:
We have two talks this time to welcome in the new year. We can't offer you the answer to life the universe and everything else, but we can offer Simon Vandereecken who will give a talk about a parent theme he created called Forty Two. Forty Two is based on the Foundation framework from Zurb. See, not everything has to use Bootstrap.

Simon is webmaster at Proximus, @nithou on Twitter and his own site is here http://www.nithou.net

You can find his theme here https://github.com/nithou/Fortytwo-Theme

Then I'll give a talk aimed at the artists and creators amongst you who want to sell digital assets such as ebooks, illustations, photos, music etc. from your WordPress site.

Something for everyone.

Then of course, drinks in the bar downstairs afterwards.
how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs in the Casablanca II room
name: WordPress January Meetup

description:
4 talks this month!

Writing Lean by Richard Medic.

Richard will share his own writing methodology and talk about how you can develop your own methodology to fit your audience and goals.

Sticking with the communication theme, Philippe Schifflers will give a presentation about community management.

Ruben Bellens will give a short talk about using WordPress for internal team communications.

And finally Eric Wayaffe, photographer, will explain why he uses Sell Media on his photography website http://graphpaperpress.com/plugins/sell-media/
name: WordPress February Meetup - Writing Lean

description:
Tech Talk

The Themosis PHP Framework looks like other modern PHP frameworks such as Laravel and it's designed specifically for WordPress. And it's made in Belgium.

I'm very excited that the Julien Lambé, the creator of Themosis, has agreed to come and present the framework to the group.

This will be a technical talk aimed at PHP developers or people that are learning PHP.


Julien will demo building a site from scratch using the framework and give attendees early access to Themosis.


After the talk ( approximately 20h30 ) we'll hold a surgery for all members, where you can bring your WordPress questions and we'll try and help each other.

And of course we'll manage to spend a bit of time in the bar downstairs.
name: WordPress March Meetup - Themosis Framework

description:
Chris and Gilbert share tips and tools for podcasting with WordPress.

Chris appears on the podcast Internet Business Questions while Gilbert is one half of Tech Brew. 

Although we could ;-) we won't talk about it all night so bring your laptop and your WordPress problems/questions and let's help each other out.
name: WordPress April Meetup - Podcast-tastic!

description:
** Please note we are in the Bangkok room, not Casablanca II **

Writing Lean by Richard Medic.

Richard will share his own writing methodology and talk about how you can develop your own methodology to fit your audience and goals.

Designing URLs by Kristof Bernaert

How to devise a strategy for your URL structure and why it matters.

WPBRU Kids Blogging Camp

We'll be running a one day kids camp this Summer to get kids blogging and using WordPress. We'll have a short discussion about this to see who has ideas and who would like to help.

Members' Websites

A regular slot at our meetups, take the plunge, show us your website and get feedback from the group. Always a useful exercise for any website owner.
how_to_find_us: The meeting is in the Bangkok room.
name: WordPress Meetup - May

description:
Official Launch Of WordPress Brussels Community Website

Come and learn more about how you can benefit from and contribute to the new WordPress Brussels Community website by finding the people and answers you need to keep your projects moving forward.

W3République


Lise Slimane will present w3republique.com , an e-democracy platform.

Building A Membership Business With Member Mouse

Learn more about how to get up and running quickly with Member Mouse so that you can concentrate on building your memberships based business.
name: WordPress June Meetup

description:
WordPress Security

1. Your responsibility as a website owner

2. Security Plugins

3. Security tips for devs and themers
name: WordPress Meetup July

description:
3 short talks this month:

1. Building an e-learning system with WordPress

2. Introduction to HTML and CSS for writers

3. Table Press plugin
name: WordPress September Meetup

description:
1. Why and How To Create a Child Theme

2. Speeding Up You Website
name: WordPress Meetup October

description: Open format : Show and Tell
name: WordPress November Meetup

description: No slides this time, just socialising. And prizes!
name: WordPress December Party
